20:12 <@cjdelisle> is it ok that the ports on the executor are open to the world?  
20:12 <@cjdelisle> user@debo8:~$ nmap agent-1.maven.xwiki.org -p 6666 | grep 6666  
20:12 <@cjdelisle> 6666/tcp open  irc  
20:13 <@cjdelisle> if someone opens a connection to that port and refuses to close it then that will hang the system good  
20:13 <@cjdelisle> hrm, wonder what other ports are open...  
20:18 <sburjan`> cjdelisle: I have a db related question. Are you familiar with H2 ?  
20:19 <@cjdelisle> not really but try anyway  
20:20 <sburjan`> in normal distro (jetty+hsqldb), the database is stores as an sql script, which is run at every startup  
20:20 <sburjan`> \*stored  
20:20 <sburjan`> I need to do the same in H2. it seems H2 stores the db in binary  
20:21 <sburjan`> I'm looking at the H2's manual, but I can't find anything to help  
20:22 <@cjdelisle> I'm really shakey on how the default stuff actually works but what I think happens is it starts the wiki and does an import then it saves the state of the database  
20:23 <@cjdelisle> the state is db specific, it doesn't matter what type of db it is, to us it's just a blob and we pass it to the db and the db reads it  
20:23 <sburjan`> yes, but when shutting down xwiki, all the db content is in plain format (readable)  
20:24 <@cjdelisle> are you trying to mine this file for something?  
20:24 <@cjdelisle> what is the end goal?  
20:25 <sburjan`> I have an app (not related to xwiki).. and I use h2, but I don't have any sql file in plain. H2 creates the database in binary, not in plain text  
20:26 <sburjan`> my jdbcUrl is jdbc:h2:file:~database.sql an I get a ~datababase.sql.h2.db .. which is binary  
20:26 <@cjdelisle> and you want to turn this into an import script?  
20:26 <sburjan`> something like that, yes  
20:26 <sburjan`> basically.. exactly like tht :)  
20:27 <@cjdelisle> google h2 dump utilities?  
20:29 <sburjan`> I was hoping that h2 has something native in this. They have some encryption bullshit on thei manual, but nothing regarding on how the file is stored on disk  
20:46 <Chami1> has quit
